sen.j: 延寿寺（えんじゅじ）は、滋賀県彦根市にある臨済宗永源寺派の禅寺。
sen.e: Enjyu-ji Temple is a Zen temple (a temple belonging to the Zen sect) of Eigenji school of the Rinzai sect in Hikone City, Shiga Prefecture.
Enjyu-ji Temple is a Zen temple (a temple belonging to the Zen sect) of Eigenji school of the Rinzai sect in Hikone City, Shiga Prefecture.
Enjyu-ji Temple is a Zen temple (a temple belonging to the Zen sect) of Eigenji school of the Rinzai sect in Hikone City, Shiga Prefecture.
The sango (the name of a group of Buddhist temples to which the temple belongs) is永明山.
The sango (literally "mountain name," the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple) is 永明山.
sen.cmt: 山号の説明を変更しました。永明山の読み方不明です。
sen.e: The sango (literally "mountain name," the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple) is 永明山.
The honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Kanzeon Bosatsu.
The honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Kanzeon Bosatsu.
The honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Kanzeon Bosatsu.
History
History
History

sen.j: この寺は、749年（天平勝宝元年）行基によって創建されたと伝えられる。
sen.e: This temple is said to have been founded by Gyogi in 749.
This temple is said to have been founded by Gyogi in 749.
This temple is said to have been founded by Gyogi in 749.

sen.j: かつては天台宗に属していたが、江戸時代に入り復興されて臨済宗に改められた。
sen.e: It used to belong to the Tendai sect, however, in the Edo period it changed to the Rinzai sect.
Although it used to belong to the Tendai sect, in the Edo period it changed to the Rinzai sect.
Although it used to belong to the Tendai sect, in the Edo period it changed to the Rinzai sect.
